meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting an early symptom indicating the onset of a disease.
meanings.sent1: The prodromal fever warned of the upcoming illness.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recognized the prodromal signs of the disease.
meanings.sent3: The prodromal headache made him realize he should have taken better care of himself.
meanings.sent4: Her prodromal fatigue was like a silent alarm for the impending sickness.
meanings.sent5: The prodromal rash was a red flag for the approaching illness.

meanings.definition: A symptom or sign that precedes a disease.
meanings.sent1: The prodromal of the flu was a runny nose.
meanings.sent2: She experienced several prodromals before the full onset of the illness.
meanings.sent3: The prodromal of the cold was a sneeze that wouldn't stop.
meanings.sent4: His constant yawning was a clear prodromal of his fatigue.
meanings.sent5: The prodromal of the virus was a sudden loss of appetite.
